thread.title: La Balena and Il Grillo: Earthy, rustic Italian flavors

author: Michael Bauer
title: La Balena and Il Grillo: Earthy, rustic Italian flavors
text:
Photo: James Tensuan, Special To The Chronicle print_article_embed|photo-8568013|article-6497238|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-8568013|article-6497238|1 email_share_embed|photo-8568013|article-6497238|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-8568013|article-6497238|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-8568013|article-6497238|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-8568013|article-6497238|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-8568013|article-6497238|5 google_share_embed|photo-8568013|article-6497238|6 La Balena in Carmel-by-the-Sea. La Balena in Carmel-by-the-Sea.
In Carmel-by-the-Sea, where dozens of restaurants and cafes echo the town’s quaint charm, Emanuele and Anna Bartolini seem to go a different direction by channeling the rugged California coastline. La Balena in Carmel-by-the-Sea. La Balena in Carmel-by-the-Sea.
In Carmel-by-the-Sea, where dozens of restaurants and cafes echo the town’s quaint charm, Emanuele and Anna Bartolini seem to go a different direction by channeling the rugged California coastline.
